nnMPt1k0Y_9q5cYQXE0u-w.text: Great healthy food! Basil chicken is Soo good even though it's really simple and looks as if it's tasteless, but it's not, not at all. Been ordering their basil chicken takeaway for 3 times cos it's that good, for a 'healthy Meal'. Go for the coriander lime sauce and garlic chilli, am in love. Ordered their set meal @ $14.90 which comes with a snack (banana bread) and drink (got a coconut water). For the snack, if U're sugar conscious, u might not wanna have the Apple muesli bar as it's kinda sweet which defeats the purpose of a 'healthy diet'. Go for the banana bread, not as sweet as the Apple muesli yet tasty.If you're thinking of adding on some dessert, wouldn't recommend their açai sorbet as it has that  about-to-turn-bad taste unlike fresh açai from other outlets. Also, it's kinda sweet.I would highly recommend YOLO if U're searching for a healthy, tasty diet option! Their meals are suitable for halal/vegatarian consumer as well. Fuss free too. Delivery from food panda/Deliveroo has been fuss free for me. This is definitely one of my to-go-to diet option especially if I'm looking to build up some muscles and cut on some fats. Lean bod here I come!

I6kIcnZBz4QvNfhVlx6eAQ.text: Health bowls have been very popular lately so when I had the chance to pop by YOLO on a weekday dinner I thought I would give it a shot. Food was decent but production was very slow and service was subpar. For similar price I would choose to go to Daily Cut or Grain Traders, both of which are located within walking distance.

4O08cvYjMBbU37OrgdbPjQ.text: It's steps away from my house, and it's healthy, so it's a win win for yours truly.  I like to cook, don't get me wrong, but it's kind of a pain for one person, so if I'm coming home late, or coming from a work out, YOLO is perfect.  It's not super expensive, and I can grab something that I don't feel guilty about.  The selection is strong you can make your own protein bowl, or choose from their menu.  I've had the meatballs, the quinoa cakes, and the coconut soup.  All were good, and low calorie.  Would definitely give it a whirl if you are looking to watch your diet, or just looking for a healthy alternative.

l5Y8m_4NdrYiP0mS16ziGA.text: This place has gone downhill fast! Horrible service with lukewarm and bland food. Took close to 30 min just to get a wrap with the employee just making up some BS excuse. Been the same level of service last couple times I've been there, so this is the last visit. Don't waste your time here

IGAre_3rWltckPyDxqsweg.text: Ordered delivery via ubereats, and was quite disappointed. They forgot the sauce for one of our meals, and gave the wrong main protein as well (friend ordered the Salmon quinoa patty but was given Salmon instead). Was also unpleasantly surprised at the lack of consistency when it came to drinks - one cup was only about half full, while the other was 3/4 full. Both were tightly wrapped so nothing was spilt in transport. Also, don't try the Tropical Boost - tastes very odd. Go with the Peanut Butter Chocolate instead, that was tasty.

6SVkSnx7e3FsmN9Y1zU3lQ.text: YOLO is a great lunch option that I grab on the go to take back to work after the gym.  I stick to the Shape Up menu items as it's perfect for my low carb diet.  I've tried most of the items under this category and have been very pleased so far.  The cost is reasonable, a bit on the pricey side, but for the quality of food served I am willing to pay a bit extra to get what I need for my diet.  It keeps my life coach happy too!   I will definitely keep YOLO as a regular lunch option.  Try the lite bite menu items too.  The cashew & kale dip with veggies sticks is a winner for me.

photos.caption: Photo of YOLO - Singapore, Singapore. Salmon quinoa burger with mixed salad
Photo of YOLO - Singapore, Singapore. Cashew & kale dip with veggie sticks

ESKQB7ZpF1Jr3sulNL5YoA.text: Healthy quick option inside Icon Village so highly convenient for the Tanjong Pagar lunch crowd but with the likes of competitors Daily Cut and Grain Traders (albeit slightly pricier) both offering greater value and both right around the same area, can't say this is my first pick towards this ever-popular trend towards healthier warm grain/protein/ veggie bowls

Gbo_o9TCL3x8foryipyClQ.text: I wouldnt say that food here tends to be the most health conscious but over the years its gotten better. There was a brief period I saw the kopitiam in NUH show the calories on a few of the "healthier" items but then they took them off because no one was probably reading it anyways.  YOLO is a really great concept. They focus on healthy ingredients and healthy eating. Eating with keeping in mind what youre putting into your body. Keeping track of the protein, glycemic index, etc. Its really one of the only places Ive seen with this in mind.  The food is relatively cheap and pretty good. Its fast, well organized and the staff are very nice and friendly.  Some of the dishes arent AMAZING or anything but most the food is tasty and satisfying. A good place for a quick healthy meal.  Its a regular stop for me after hitting the gym. Definitely recommend it.

gvJ1Etj-mBRvbWrn2rr4cA.text: After a workout, this place is tough to beat. It's a dream for someone living the Paleo lifestyle. I wasn't in the area of the restaurant, so I ordered through Food Panda and had them deliver. I got the cauliflower fried rice with chicken and the beef steak with sweet potato mash. Both were very good and delivery was very fast, with food at the door in about thirty minutes. The food is simple and healthy. If you're not training, you might find it a bit bland, but it's a pretty easy fix to add your own seasoning if you need more. Now I just need to actually make a visit to the restaurant!

hSaF8SU8b7z-BGKK40d2Ng.text: My favorite place in Singapore! I live right beside it so I may be bias but it's healthy, wholesome and very tasty! They give you calorie counts for everything and the price is very reasonable. My go-to is lamb, sweet potato mash, Asian greens, garlic & chili with coriander & lime sauce. Try it!

DuUNeftoBdudV2jGlWUbWA.text: This place is a little breath of fresh air. It's got great options (that are also super healthy) like their chicken quesadillas. They were cheesy, tasty, and flavorful. They came with some chips (and salad) which could have been better. Seems like they didn't try with that. However, considering there aren't that many healthy options here... I think they're headed in the right direction!
